verses.verse: (Job 22:19; Ps. 32:11) The righteous shall be glad in the LORD, and trust in Him. And all the upright in heart shall glory.
(Praise to God for His Salvation and Providence) To the Chief Musician. A Psalm of David. A Song. [1] Praise is awaiting You, O God, in Zion; And to You the vow shall be performed.
O You who hear prayer, ((Is. 66:23)) To You all flesh will come.
Iniquities prevail against me; As for our transgressions, You will (Ps. 51:2; 79:9; Is. 6:7; (Heb. 9:14; 1 John 1:7, 9)) provide atonement for them.

(Ps. 33:12) Blessed is the man You (Ps. 4:3) choose, And cause to approach You, That he may dwell in Your courts. (Ps. 36:8) We shall be satisfied with the goodness of Your house, Of Your holy temple.
By awesome deeds in righteousness You will answer us, O God of our salvation, You who are the confidence of all the ends of the earth, And of the far-off seas;
Who established the mountains by His strength, (Ps. 93:1) Being clothed with power;
(Matt. 8:26) You who still the noise of the seas, The noise of their waves, (Is. 17:12, 13) And the tumult of the peoples.
They also who dwell in the farthest parts are afraid of Your signs; You make the outgoings of the morning and evening rejoice.
You visit the earth and ((Deut. 11:12); Jer. 5:24) water it, You greatly enrich it; (Ps. 46:4; 104:13; 147:8) The river of God is full of water; You provide their grain, For so You have prepared it.
You water its ridges abundantly, You settle its furrows; You make it soft with showers, You bless its growth.
You crown the year with Your goodness, And Your paths drip with abundance.
They drop on the pastures of the wilderness, And the little hills rejoice on every side.
The pastures are clothed with flocks; (Is. 44:23; 55:12) The valleys also are covered with grain; They shout for joy, they also sing.
(Praise to God for His Awesome Works) To the Chief Musician. A Song. A Psalm. [1] Make (Ps. 100:1) a joyful shout to God, all the earth!
Sing out the honor of His name; Make His praise glorious.
Say to God, “How (Ps. 65:5) awesome are Your works! (Ps. 18:44) Through the greatness of Your power Your enemies shall submit themselves to You.
(Ps. 117:1; Zech. 14:16) All the earth shall worship You And sing praises to You; They shall sing praises to Your name.” Selah
Come and see the works of God; He is awesome in His doing toward the sons of men.
(Ex. 14:21) He turned the sea into dry land; (Josh. 3:14-16) They went through the river on foot. There we will rejoice in Him.
